document.docAuthor: Ribeiro, José Moacir Ferreira & Rafael, José Albertino
document.masterDocTitle: Description of one new species and a key to adults of Macrogynoplax Enderlein (Plecoptera, Perlidae) from Reserva Florestal Adolpho Ducke, Amazonas, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of one new species and a key to adults of Macrogynoplax Enderlein (Plecoptera, Perlidae) from Reserva Florestal Adolpho Ducke, Amazonas, Brazil

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazônia, Curso de pós-graduação em Entomologia Caixa Postal 478, CEP 69011 - 970. Amazonas, Brasil. E-mail: moacir @ inpa. gov. br, jarafael @ inpa. gov. br National Counsel of Technological and Scientific Development (CNPq)

Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazônia, Curso de pós-graduação em Entomologia Caixa Postal 478, CEP 69011 - 970. Amazonas, Brasil. E-mail: moacir @ inpa. gov. br, jarafael @ inpa. gov. br National Counsel of Technological and Scientific Development (CNPq)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Macrogynoplax pulchra Ribeiro-Ferreira & Froehlich, 1999:134
, figs. 7–13.
Froehlich, 2003:133
(key).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body greenish yellow in life, but whitish in alcohol. Tergum ten of males without sensilla basiconica. The aedeagus lacks penial hooks and the apex of the tube is long and narrows distally. The paraproct has an acute tip with a well-developed subapical spine. The female subgenital plate is wide, covers sternum nine, and has a small transverse furrow along the posterior margin.
Variations. Length of male 7.1–9.6 mm ; head 0.7–1.1 mm long, 1.4–1.7 mm wide; forewing 10.5–12.0 mm long, 3.4–4.1 wide; hindwing 9.4–10.3 mm long, 4.0– 4.4 mm wide.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Condition of the holotype :
Dissected abdomen in micro vial with glycerin, exuviae separate inside Eppendorf tube, rest of body separate in a glass vial, all inside a larger glass jar with alcohol.

Note. Original publication cites 25.iii.1987 as collection date, while specimen label reads
25.iii. 1988
in the handwriting of one of the authors (A.C. Ferreira-Ribeiro). The publication is most likely incorrect.
